newsitem.title: USA: Mobil CEO says downstream ventures eyed.
newsitem.headline: Mobil CEO says downstream ventures eyed.

text.p: Energy giant Mobil Corp believes that all companies involved in refining and marketing and refining are looking at joint ventures.

Chief executive Lucio Noto told reporters after the company's annual meeting that talks between Royal Dutch Shell and Texaco Inc may redefine acceptable levels of market domination in the U.S. retail market.
"Public policy in the past has considered it would not be possible to have double-digit national market share. Shell and Texaco may change that," Noto said.
Mobil has a seven to eight percent share nationwide in petroleum marketing, but that is heavily concentrated in key regional markets, where in some states it has 15 percent.
Mobil aims to grow its business by an average 13 to 15 percent a year, based on higher volumes and further cost-cutting, Noto said.
"We do not expect any help from energy prices. Brent will trade where it has traded in real terms at around $17-$18," he said.
